DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether measurable disease being present a starting point to which things may be compared.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to measurable disease being present a starting point to which things may be compared.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Capable of being measured.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Baseline; an imaginary standard by which things are measured or compared.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient have measurab
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have measurable disease at baseline

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Bidimensionally measurable or evaluable disease by gadolinium MRI or contrast CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the participant have measurable disease to pre-intervention?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the participant have measurable disease to pre-intervention?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable or evaluable disease by MRI or CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Bidimensionally measurable or evaluable disease by MRI or CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable or evaluable disease by gadolinium MRI or contrast CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable disease by CT and/or MRI scan at study enrollment*

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable disease by CT and/or MRI scan at study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there documentation by PET/CT scan, CT scan, or MRI that the patient has untreated measurable metastatic disease per RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease and at least one target lesion to be used to access response as defined by RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease as defined by RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable tumor on MRI or CT scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease based on RECIST 1.1, as determined by the site?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have measurable disease (as defined by RECIST 1.1) prior to starting chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease (as defined by RECIST 1.1) at time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease as defined by the presence of at least one measurable lesion per RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease at time of study enrollment according to RECIST criteria indicated in section 10.2.2.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there evaluable disease on MRI/ultrasound?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG Text_11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease (node positive or metastatic) as defined by RECIST version1.1 excluding the primary tumor

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have bidimensionally measurable disease (at least one lesion with longest diameter greater than or equal to 1.5 cm)?
